text:
The appearance of the piriformis muscle syndrome in computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging. A case report and review of the literature.
 The piriformis syndrome (PS) is a controversial cause of hip pain because of the lack of objective findings to support the diagnosis.
 Computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance (MR) imaging revealed PS in a 27-year-old woman.
 This case may be one of the first reports in the literature on a piriformis muscle enlargement documented by CT and MR imaging.
